page.title: 08East Hyde - The Village
page.content: {East Hyde}is a quiet, peaceful hamlet with the{R. Lea}meandering close by and a{railway viaduct}passing over the valley. There are{three meeting {places;}the{church,}a{pub,}and the {village hall.}Two{services}are held in the church each month. The pub.,{The } {Leather Bottle,}is cosy and people go there for a chat and sometimes to have a meal. There was a{school}but it{closed}in {1984,}and is now the{village hall,}for which activities are being planned. There is{no shop}in East Hyde and people have to travel{two miles}to Harpenden or Luton for a{post office or{any kind of shop.}Not even {newspapers}are delivered.{Buses}run once an hour, so most people have {cars}or{motor-bikes. East Hyde}would appeal to people who like a{peaceful {life}in the countryside.
